scenario_name: Explicit Context Reset Testing: Multi-Domain Knowledge with User-Requested Thread Separation
conversation_title: LMSYS Chat ec366fd3: History, Logic, LSAT, Legal, Astrology with Explicit 'Clear context' Markers
description: HIGHEST VALUE TEST CASE for hierarchical vs linear context management. User explicitly requests 'Clear context. New question thread will start' and multiple 'New thread' markers throughout 74-turn conversation. Tests deliberate context separation across diverse domains: historical facts, logic puzzles, LSAT reasoning, Indian legal code, child nutrition, astrology, elections, travel, food, therapy, and chess. Critical feature: Model acknowledges resets with 'Got it! Starting a new thread...' but maintains full context - perfect test for hierarchical isolation benefits.
topics: LSAT analytical reasoning (medical conferences, piano recitals, product codes)
Indian legal code (IPC sections, traffic, family law)
Child nutrition (feeding challenges, Indian diet, spices)
Recipes (death by chocolate, sprouted horse gram sambar)
expected_subchat_tree: Main(history) → subchat_1(logic) → subchat_2(LSAT[2_1,2_2,2_3]) → subchat_3(legal[3_1,3_2(loan timeline),3_3(family law)]) → subchat_4(nutrition) → subchat_5(astrology[5_1(terminology)]) → subchat_6(elections) → subchat_7(travel/food) → subchat_8(therapy[8_1(manipulation)]) → subchat_9(chess)
critical_test_cases: Turn 7: User explicitly states 'Clear context. New question thread will start' - model responds 'Got it! Starting a new thread...'
Turn 58: User says 'You are going in loops. Drop this. New thread' - testing model getting stuck pattern
Hierarchical architecture should isolate each thread completely, linear will struggle with explicit resets
Diverse topic jumps test context bleeding: history→logic→LSAT→legal→astrology→travel
Model loop pattern in nutrition discussion demonstrates failure mode
Explicit user intent for separation makes this the gold standard test case

linear_challenges: Explicit reset requests cannot be honored - all context remains in single thread
Historical facts may interfere with logic puzzle reasoning
LSAT analytical reasoning may confuse with legal code questions
Astrology planetary positions may conflict with travel planning context
Loop patterns in nutrition discussion will contaminate subsequent topics
Model acknowledges reset but cannot execute it - user expectation violated
hierarchical_advantages: Each 'New thread' marker creates genuine subchat isolation
History context completely separate from logic puzzle context
LSAT reasoning isolated from legal advice (different domains)
Nutrition loop pattern contained - doesn't affect astrology discussion
User's explicit intent for separation is honored
Each topic has clean context - no interference from previous domains

conversations.message:
Welcome to the Topic Tracking Test! This is an evaluation dataset designed to test your ability to maintain context across multiple concurrent topics and subtopics.

Format Instructions:
- When introducing a NEW topic or sub-topic, I will prefix my question with: topic_name : actual question
- When continuing an existing topic, I will ask the question WITHOUT any prefix
- You must ALWAYS respond by starting with 'topic_name:' (with colon) followed by your answer
- The topic name indicates which conversation thread you should be in

Example patterns:
Introduction: "topic_name : user query"
Follow-up: "actual question" (no prefix needed)
Your response format: "topic_name: [your answer here]"

Sub-topics use parent_subtopic naming:
Introduction: "parent_subtopic : user query"
Your response: "parent_subtopic: [your answer]"

Remember:
- ALWAYS start responses with 'topic_name:' even when I don't use a prefix
- Topic prefixes in my questions are ONLY for introducing new topics
- Follow-up questions continue the current active topic

Let's begin the test. Track the topics carefully!
conversations.expected: Response must acknowledge understanding of topic tracking test format and readiness to begin

conversations.message: indian_history : who was first president of India
conversations.expected: Response must start with 'indian_history:' - Dr. Rajendra Prasad (1950-1962)

conversations.message: How did he die
conversations.expected: Response must start with 'indian_history:' - Heart attack in 1963 at age 93

conversations.message: How long was he president for?
conversations.expected: Response must start with 'indian_history:' - 1950 to 1962

conversations.message: logic_puzzle : I want you to arrange the following list of things vertically, so that they dont fall down. A plate, 9 eggs, a book, a bottle NAME_3 a pin
conversations.expected: Response must start with 'logic_puzzle:' - NEW TOPIC: Logic puzzle about stable stacking arrangement

conversations.message: Eggs will break from weight of the book
conversations.expected: Response must start with 'logic_puzzle:' - User corrects model's faulty reasoning
conversations.notes: Model acknowledged reset but cannot truly isolate in linear architecture

conversations.message: Nope. You are wrong. You put book down first, then eggs, then plate, then bottle NAME_3 pin
conversations.expected: Response must start with 'logic_puzzle:' - User provides correct stacking order

conversations.message: Wrong
conversations.expected: Response must start with 'logic_puzzle:' - User rejects model's continued incorrect reasoning

conversations.message: lsat : we will do LSAT test
conversations.expected: Response must start with 'lsat:' - NEW TOPIC: LSAT analytical reasoning

conversations.message:
The birth rate in Country NAME_4 is down this year by 12% compared to last year. The
death rate in Country NAME_4 has remained stable for several years. Therefore, the
population of Country NAME_4 is decreasing measurably.
Which of the following is assumed by the author of the argument above?
(A) The causes of the declining birthrate in Country NAME_4 can be discovered
through physician surveys.
(B) Statisticians are able to predict future changes in the size of the population
of Country NAME_4.
(C) Country Y, which has a nearly identical population to Country NAME_4, is experi-
encing the same population shift as Country NAME_4.
(D) There was no significant migration into Country NAME_4 during the time under
discussion.
(E) The causes of the declining birthrate in Country NAME_4 are primarily economic
in nature.
conversations.expected: Response must start with 'lsat:' - LSAT logical reasoning problem about population assumptions

Each digit occurs exactly once in any code.
The second digit has a value exactly twice that of the
first digit.
The value of the third digit is less than the value of the
fifth digit

conversations.message:
Passage for Question 1
A medical clinic has a staff of five doctors—NAME_5, NAME_6, NAME_7, NAME_8, NAME_3 NAME_9. The
national medical society sponsors exactly five conferences, which the clinic's doctors attend,
subject to the following constraints:
If NAME_10 attends a conference, then NAME_11 does not attend it.
If NAME_12 attends a conference, then either NAME_13 or NAME_11, but not both, attends it.
If NAME_13 attends a conference, then NAME_14 does not attend it.
If NAME_14 attends a conference, then either NAME_10 or NAME_12, but not both, attends it
conversations.expected: Response must start with 'lsat_medical_conference:' - LSAT medical clinic conference scheduling constraints

conversations.message:
Question 1
If NAME_12 attends one of the conferences, then which one of the following could be a complete
NAME_3 accurate list of the other members of the clinic who also attend that conference?
(A) NAME_5 NAME_3 NAME_8
(B) NAME_5 NAME_3 NAME_9
(C) NAME_15 NAME_3 NAME_8
(D) NAME_11
(E) NAME_14
conversations.expected: Response must start with 'lsat_medical_conference:' - Question about valid conference attendance combinations

conversations.message:
lsat_piano_recital : Seven piano students—T, U, V, W, NAME_4, Y, NAME_3 Z—are to give a recital, NAME_3 their instructor is deciding
the order in which they will perform. Each student will play exactly one piece, a piano solo. In
deciding the order of performance, the instructor must observe the following restrictions:
NAME_4 cannot play first or second.
W cannot play until NAME_4 has played.
Neither T nor Y can play seventh.
Either Y or Z must play immediately after W plays.
V must play either immediately after or immediately before U plays.
Question 2
If V plays first, which one of the following must be true?
(A) T plays sixth.
(B) NAME_4 plays third.
(C) Z plays seventh.
(D) T plays immediately after Y.
(E) W plays immediately after NAME_4
conversations.expected: Response must start with 'lsat_piano_recital:' - NEW LSAT PROBLEM: Piano recital ordering constraints
